title: Network Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Milwaukee, WI)
Interview Descriptions: They just want to know you have a good background and they will train you to do the job in an effective way. The interview were basic questions about networking which I learned from some classes.
Interview Questions: What is your background about networking? Have you done any physical work? Tell us about yourself.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Milwaukee, WI) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview with recruiter. Interview was scheduled quickly but was rescheduled on the morning of the interview due to some conflict which was annoying. Otherwise genrally professional and prompt communication.
Interview Questions: Q: Describe your strengths. Q: Why do you think you’re a good fit for this role? Q: Are you pursuing other opportunities?

title: Health Council Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview was well structure and thought provoking. Questions perplex but well formulated. Must come prepared to give insight and well thought out responses. I did come prepared with a powerpoint for the interviewers to follow along with and make references. Interview took nearly 45 min and was structure with the two interviewers going back and forth to answer questions. Took time and made conversation relatable.
Interview Questions: What do you plan to contribute to the team.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Wisconsin
Interview Descriptions: No direct interview. I turned in my credentials and I was awarded the TA ship position by the university. Decisions are made by the department (hiring dept). I did an interview with some select professors based on research interest
Interview Questions: No direct interview. I turned in my credentials and I was awarded the TA ship position by the university. Decisions are made by the department (hiring dept).

title: HR Assitant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Set of interview questions with two assistant managers and then came back for a second interview with head manager a couple of days later; was hired a few days later and then was given an orientation
Interview Questions: What are my strengths and weaknesses?

title: Donor Experience Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Well  planned and safety precautions were followed. Enjoyed learning more about the Foundation but it was not a good fit for either of us. The description made it seem like it was an established role not a brand new idea.
Interview Questions: What is your management style

title: Campus Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Wisconsin
Interview Descriptions: I saw the job posting in my school email. After the application, I received the email scheduled an in-person interview. Got the job soon after. The whole process took a month or two.
Interview Questions: Mock scenario, how to say the opening statement.

title: Telephone Interviewer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy and not super formal. First I had a phone interview that went over basic topics such as my availability, interest in the position, and logistics of training/work hours. After that I was asked back for an in person practice call and typing test. The practice call involved me reading a script and the typing test was not rigorous. After that I was offered a position and then entered training. The UWSC hires a lot of students and from what I've heard, most people that interview get offered a job! Nice people and easy interview process.
Interview Questions: "Our shifts are 4 hours long, do you think you could spend that much time on the phone/computer?"

title: Sr Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin
Interview Descriptions: Interview process overall was relatively easy.  However, a panel interviews a candidate first that has nothing to do with the job, position or department in general.
Interview Questions: The interview questions almost had nothing to do with the position itself.

title: Center Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Milwaukee, WI) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: First, you get an email inviting you to select from a list of available times to interview on the phone. Then you have a phone interview with about five people asking you questions. A few weeks later you may get invited to interview in person.
Interview Questions: How have you contributed to developing diversity?

title: Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process two-tiered.  The first interview is at state level and is conducted in Madison.  The second interview is at county level, includes county board supervisors, county HR and is conducted in county.  Interview candidate will need to prepare presentation on pre-selected topic.
Interview Questions: what is your educational background and experience

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Standard grad school process which is used for evaluating candidates for research positions for masters and phd level education all over the united states of america. Grad record exam is required and then you look for faculty who are working in your area of interest.
Interview Questions: What are you passionate about

title: Library Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Wisconsin
Interview Descriptions: Casual setting that was open to questions.  The interview did not take long and covered most of the basic and classic interview questions that most employers tend to ask new hires.
Interview Questions: What is one of your greatest strengths?

title: Biostatistican I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The job I interviewed for was with the Medical College, specifically research with the CIBMTR. This was the first round of interviews - just a quick 15 minute chat on the phone. The woman interviewing me was nice and asked me around 10 questions - all very standard interview questions, nothing really technical or specific to the job.
Interview Questions: Strengths, weaknesses, what is your management style, where do you see yourself in 5 years, etc.

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Formal panel interview with other department heads after an initial phone screening.  Largely structured questions as part of a formal interviewing process.   Less about technology and more about managing a diverse workforce.
Interview Questions: Strong focus on diversity in hiring, team development, and communication style.

title: Academic Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin
Interview Descriptions: Phone Screen with 3 people; only 1 asked questions. Many questions were about my ability to do the job; they were definitely asking questions from a pre-written list. The hiring process seemed like they were handicapped by human resources and the position has been empty for quite some time due to that.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position and how can you contribute to this department?

title: Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral interview; three questions to see if you're customer service oriented. They were looking for you to talk about customer service, communication, and critical thinking. Interview was with two employees.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you worked a with a group.

title: Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin
Interview Descriptions: They emailed first and then I called back. Had skype interview with basic questions at first, then after, they called my references. then an in-person with a presentation on a topic that they gave me. they called back the same day.
Interview Questions: Name a time you worked with underserved populations

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (La Crosse, WI) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a sit down in chair's office, he asked me 5 questions about teaching philosophy, then gave me a sheet describing the class I would teach and the times that it met.  He gave me a syllabus from the last instructor and told me I could use it or change it.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a panel of three of the departments researchers. They asked about my past experience/projects. They also asked what I thought I could contribute to the department. The interview lasted a little more than an hour
Interview Questions: What attracted you to the role/position

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Wisconsin
Interview Descriptions: Quick, it was a two week process. Right after I applied they emailed me wanting to set up a phone interview. After the phone interview they schedules an in person interview with all of the human resources staff. About a week after the in person interview I was given an offer and had accepted
Interview Questions: What are important aspects of human resources? What experience have you had that makes you a good candidate?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and they scheduled for skype interview. 3 people interviewing me and they said that they gonna ask me 13 questions. The interview went for 40 mins.
Interview Questions: How do you update yourself with current technology

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Wisconsin
Interview Descriptions: You submit an application online to the program. The program will respond to you and schedule you for an interview. The interview was behavioral questions conducted by the supervisor of the program. The interview lasted to about 20-30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Name a conflict you had and how did you solve it.

title: Research Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted for a Skype interview a few days later.  It was a panel interview and they rotated around the table who was asking questions.  About 5 minutes before the interview, they sent me a list of the questions they were going to ask so I could look it over.
Interview Questions: typical behavioral questions

title: Research Associate-employee In Training Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Telephonic, Technical and HR. Asked about my background, work experience and future directions. I was interviewed with 8 persons on different timings. I was also taken to lunch and dinner. Overall the process i was good and manageable.
Interview Questions: General HR questions Asked about my background, work experience and future directions

title: Fond Du Lac County Bilingual 4-H Youth Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin
Interview Descriptions: I was required to prepare a two-page maximum cover letter in response as to how my experiences met each minimum qualification and submitted my resume in addition to a standard online job seeking account. I was contacted a month later that I was selected for an interview and was asked for my availability on a given day. The interview was with 4 members, one the direct boss I would have been working under, a lady from the offices in Madison, an AmeriCorps Vista member, and the co-department head. The interview was over Skype where I was projected on a screen in front of them.
Interview Questions: There were multiple questions regarding my experience educating youth, of which my experience is limited, making those questions difficult to answer.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI)
Interview Descriptions: Standard graduate school application and interview. Online application with essays, test scores, recommendations. Interview and visit weekend with day-long series of interviews, weekend-long assessment by interaction with current students.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to pursue a PhD?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview. Very straightforward. Nice guy (boss) interviewing, 30 minutes or so. He asked all the basic questions about research and teaching. Easy to talk to, relaxed. Though this was overall an easy interview - they certainly can be harder. Not sure what else to say, just be prepared to address all the core questions about your experience and expertise.
Interview Questions: All the standard questions about research and teaching.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (New York, NY) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: 1) I sent my vita, college transcripts, letter of intent, and cover letter to the department.  2) After several months, we scheduled an interview and two demonstrations of my skills.  3) After a few weeks, I was hired.
Interview Questions: How do I work with members of the community?

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Wisconsin
Interview Descriptions: Fast and efficient interview process. A lot of university resources for clinical research, clinical and family support and options to go through and choose from; ask details so you can fit your specific profile. Senior administrators are useful, but pay attention to the fine print. Overall a comfortable setup and a friendly interview environment.
Interview Questions: Nothing out of the ordinary

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Wisconsin
Interview Descriptions: Referred to the Career Services Office. A very speedy process.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with ambiguity?

title: Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3+ months. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Long and tedious...many different steps without communication in between steps leaves you guessing if you are in the running or not.  I think that because the positions are so flexible in nature it is difficult to have a real grasp of the work and expectations often do not meet reality once the job begins.  Hiring authority is centralized with the regional office and includes county based individuals who have a vested interest in the hire.
Interview Questions: presenting your teaching/communication style to the interview team

title: Senior Online Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Wisconsin in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straightforward...phone interview with HR and then Skype interview with a few people from the hiring commitee.  Overall it was a professional and welcoming experience.  I had no complaints on the process.
Interview Questions: What did Google's Algorithm changes (Panda and Penguin) affect in SEO?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Hiring time was slow after submission of application but the process after was timely. The HR staff coordinating communications and accommodations was very helpful. 

Phone interview, on-campus interview (search committee, presentation, 1-on-1)
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position and why do you think you're the best candidate?

title: Housing Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Wisconsin
Interview Descriptions: Easy online application. Received an email for the interview. Three people interviewing- 2 current tutors and 1 other housing employee. Asked general question on why you'd be good for the job, etc. Then there was a portion where they gave you three questions in your field and had you explain how to do each problem.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Community Resource Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: First skype interview, then there were questionnaire to prepare for presentation. I conducted a research and collected the information necessary for the presentation. It took me a while to prepare as some of  people I was calling where out of the office, or not able to answer my questions. Took a while to get the presentation done the way I wanted.
Interview Questions: Three top priorities in Economic Development in the X Community.

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin
Interview Descriptions: Found job on UW-Madison's website, contacted lab via email. We set up an interview time that worked and it was very comfortable. Questions related to the job and previous education. Hiring process was quick.
Interview Questions: Not applicable. The interview questions were expected.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI)
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview process, it was more personal questions to see if I was a good fit as opposed to business related questions.
Interview Questions: What are 5 of your biggest flaws

title: Veterinary Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was given many details over email prior to the interview such as wage and expected hours.  The interview itself was very informal, but that's may be just how my department was.  Since I interviewed, they had started having candidates stay for a few hours and follow other techs around.
Interview Questions: Why I was leaving my current job

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: go through resume, why you apply for chemistry library, what you want to get from this position
Interview Questions: what are you proud of?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions:
The panel interview was as expected for University of Wisconsin - a "round up" of employees available to serve, some of which have no concept of what would (or wouldn't) make an applicant successful in the position.  I was surprised however,  with such a large institution, of some of the comments made during the process. Although I am no HR expert, they seem to have bordered on the illegal.  
I earned one of two finalist spots and when I finally met with the ultimate hiring manager, he couldn't be bothered talking to me.  Mostly spoke about himself and then cut us off at the half hour mark.  It was apparent that the hiring decision was made prior to my interview and he was just going through the motions.  It was disappointing that I took time off of work (two separate days, over two hours) to go through the interview process when, prepared my references, completed a background check, come to find out, the job went to an internal candidate that was earmarked from the beginning (based on a reliable internal source). The processes and procedures of University of Wisconsin require the protocol of a search and screen committee and panel interview. Although I feel I was the more qualified applicant, I regret I was simply used as a requirement fulfillment for this department to hire the person they had in mind from the beginning. My advice to future applicants is to verify if there is an internal applicant applying for the same position you are considering.  If there is, I would suggest withdrawing your application as I have seen this very thing happen again and again at UW.  It is a flaw in the system that unfortunately I fell victim to.
Interview Questions: How good of writer are you?

title: Computer Lab Assistance Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Stevens Point, WI) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview focus on customer services rather than tech knowledge. You will be interviewed by the manager or student coordinators. Interview questions are scenario based. After you answered the questions, they will actually tell you the polity and rule for handling the situations. If you have a good attitude to learn and service, you will get hired.
Interview Questions: What will you do if a student is talking on phone in the lab?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: usual interview for postdoctoral position, day on campus plus presentation about previous work, i had an impression that guy expected me to turn down the offer
Interview Questions: you never know what they expect from you

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I knew a UW athlete, who recommended I tutor part time when I needed a job.  The process was pretty simple, and I started a few weeks later.  Other than a single compliance meeting, there were no steps between the interview and working.
Interview Questions: There were no particularly hard questions; they just wanted to know how you would go about tutoring an athlete.  The interview didn't last more than a half hour.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Stepped in and asked if they were hiring, she gave me an interview that week. The questions were basic - what are my strengths, what are my weaknesses. How do I deal with difficult situations.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview which was fairly general in nature.  This was followed by an in person interview which lasted the better part of 4 hours.  The University is large and each hiring entity will have there own style as it pertains to interviewing.  I have found that interviews for laboratory positions are rather laid back and less formal.
Interview Questions: I was asked how I could leverage my skills to meet the needs of the lab.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: I found the job description on the internet and applied for the job. I had an interview and on campus visit. I had to present my job market paper during the campus visit. It went all well. I liked the campus and the faculty. They showed me around the campus and I heard about the benefits from the Human Resources. We went out for lunches and dinners. It was great and I had a good time. They called me a week after the campus visit.
Interview Questions: Describe your research paper

title: Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Milwaukee, WI) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very quick.
Interview Questions: Give an example of how you helped a customer.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: It first started with tough examination. The exam has fore sections and most of the people only managed to finished 2 sections. After that is a nice, inform section, going through the history of the company, the future they have. Most important, the hiring positions they have.
Interview Questions: how do you know XXX

title: Student Services Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Kenosha, WI) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: Confirmation letter acknowledging application received. Phone call offering to schedule initial phone screening. Phone screening interview with three people lasting about 1 hour. Letter offering second in person interview. Second interview consisted of 1) Panel of students, faculty, staff 2) Independent interview with program director 3) 15 minute presentation open to all members of campus community followed by Q&A. Offer by email. Negotiation by phone and email.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions:
I first give a 45 min presentation and then meet with about 8 peoples individually, I had lunch with the group. 
it is very extensive interview, you better have a really good sleep at the night before the interview. The peoples are very cold and you get be used to no smile situation.
Interview Questions: why you want to work here, what is your goal in the next five years.

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: On site
Interview Questions: Would you accept an offer if it was made today?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Nothing much to tell
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join our research lab

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: Short and to the point, offered lots of insight into what the position would entail. Interviewer proctored a skills test prior to beginning a 1:1 interview. After the interview, we toured the facility.
Interview Questions: Which is more important in a leader: listening to others or accepting responsibility -- and maybe blame?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Milwaukee, WI) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: There was a submission of CV and cover letter and based on that they shortlisted. Did not conduct a formal interview  and evaluated based on resume and references .
Interview Questions: there wasn't any specific question asked

title: Dining Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Oshkosh, WI) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview
Interview Questions: What was your biggest failure?

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Milwaukee, WI) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: phone interview, then onsite, then offer
Interview Questions: why do you think we would give you an offer?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Madison, WI) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: Questions about future research plan, interested area, interested professors.
Interview Questions: What other offiers?

title: Web Content Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin (Milwaukee, WI) in Nov 2007
Interview Descriptions:
First interviewed with Bookstore manger, then IMT manger. 
Very quick, and simple interviews since the job was designed for a student working park time hours with no Benfits. Had to call many times to get the first interview, the Bookstore director is always busy. Was asked why I want this job, what do I hope to get out of it, past experience etc.. I did not bring a portfolio. I did mention my classes in webdesign. The IMT manger was more silent, and ackward.. I felt like I had to carry the interview, and do the talking. The bookstore was very busy, while the IMT department want slow and quiet. The bookstore depends on the IMT department to keep their site up and running.
Interview Questions: why did you quit your last job?
